remarks: Define the class of all undirected simple graphs with loops.  An undirected simple graph with loops is a special undirected multigraph ` <. V , E >. ` where ` E ` is an injective (one-to-one) function into subsets of ` V ` of cardinality one or two, representing the two vertices incident to the edge, or the one vertex if the edge is a loop. In contrast to a multigraph, there is at most one edge between two vertices.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Aug-2017.)
